Based on your preferences and curiosity about deeper storytelling, I recommend you watch "The Ring Two" (2005) directed by Chan-wook Park.

In this captivating drama, a group of friends stumble upon a time portal that transports them to the past, specifically in 1945. As they navigate through treacherous historical situations and confront their own personal demons along the way, they uncover a sinister and darkly ominous plot brewing at the very core of history itself.

And as they race against time to expose this sinister plot before it's too late, they realize that the ultimate fate of not only their own lives but also the entire course of human history itself may ultimately rest not with them, not even with those who would seek to exploit their vulnerabilities and weaknesses in order to further their own selfish desires and interests, but rather with a higher power or force beyond their own control or influence, one that they are ultimately powerless against.

Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend watching "To Kill a Mockingbird" which is a classic drama film that was released in 1960.

The movie tells the story of a young girl named Scout who lives in a small town called Maycomb during the Great Depression era.

Scout and her older brother Jem are taken care of by their widowed mother Atticus Finch, who is a skilled lawyer who is hired to defend a black man against an unjust rape charge.

As Atticus Finch tries to defend his client against the injustice that has been done to him, Scout and her older brother Jem also learn important lessons about justice, fairness, and equality.

Overall, "To Kill a Mockingbird" is a classic drama film that was released in 1960 and is still widely considered to be one of the greatest movies ever made.
